intro: Mapania effusa, commonly known as the broadleaf mapania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and it is often found in lowland evergreen forests. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
